hedline.hl1: Soft Money Pours In For First Lady's Race

block.p: The national Democratic leadership, clearly concerned that Hillary Rodham Clinton is facing a tough Senate race in New York, has already channeled nearly $3 million into the state -- much of it from large, unregulated contributions known as soft money -- and is girding to spend far more.
No other Senate candidate has received anywhere near as much financial assistance from either major party, according to campaign finance records.

The national Democratic leadership, clearly concerned that Hillary Rodham Clinton is facing a tough Senate race in New York, has already channeled nearly $3 million into the state -- much of it from large, unregulated contributions known as soft money -- and is girding to spend far more.
No other Senate candidate has received anywhere near as much financial assistance from either major party, according to campaign finance records.
This infusion of money into New York reflects how rules intended to curb the role of big donations in such races have become increasingly ineffective.
